background: Annual redd counts for summer/fall Chinook (Oncorhynchus tshawytscha) are conducted throughout many river systemsin Washington state. Redd count data are combined with additional information (e.g. spawner sex-ratio, hatchery-wild composition) to monitor the status and trends of Chinook species.
title: Annual Summer/Fall Chinook Redd Surveys
assumptions:
Redds are created by a single female Chinook. 

Female Chinook create only a single redd.

Redds are observable by survey crews.

Redds are counted with reasonable accuracy (i.e. minimal double-counting, under-counting, over-counting)

The sex-ratio (which is combined with redd count data to estimate spawner abundance) obtained from passage observations at Well Dam is representative of the sex-ratio on Okanogan Basin spawning grounds (Okanogan and Similkameen Rivers)

metrics.title: Redd count by reach and by week
Spatial distribution of redds by reach
Spatial distribution of spawners (i.e. habitat use, natal site fidelity)
Sex-ratio of Chinook at Wells Dam
Temporal distribution of redds by week

objectives: Monitor status and trends in spatial distribution of redds (habitat use)
Monitor status and trends in spawn timing
Monitor status and trends in annual spawner abundance
